messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
125 Signal Hill Road.
Okay, what's going on over there?
Someone was murdered, I think?
Where exactly?
My house.
I need you to listen to me and stay calm. Where do you think someone was murdered?
In my house.
In your house? Okay, what's in your house?
Please hurry.
Ma'am, I'm sending officers right now. I need to know more about what's going on. What makes you think someone was murdered?
My husband is in a pool of blood.
Your husband is in a pool of blood?
Yes, quickly.
They're on the way. Did you just get home?
Yes.
Is anybody else home with you?
I don't see anyone.
Are you with your children right now?
No, I don't see my son. He's gone.
How old is your son?
He's 22. What does he look like? This is really important.
Normal, but I think he had some problems.
Go over to your husband for me. Is he breathing?
Are they on their way?
They've been on the way since you called. Is your husband breathing?
I don't think so.
Are you right next to him?
Yes.
Can you get close to him?
Yes, but not really with the cord.
His face is bludgeoned?
Yes.
Is there a weapon nearby?
I don't see one. Wait, yes, a pick or a hammer.
A pick or a hammer? Okay. Ma'am, they're on the way. I need you to stay on the phone with me.
I can't believe this.
Listen to me, ma'am. What I'm going to tell you is very important. I do not want you to touch anything.
Okay.
Are you certain that your husband is not breathing?
I don't know.
If you want, put the phone down and try to get as close to him as possible without touching the pick or hammer.
There's so much blood.
I know, but this is important. Is he moving?
He's not moving.
If you call his name, does he respond?
Ed. Ed. No.
Okay, I'm staying here with you until they get there. You're at 125 Signal Hill Road, correct?
Yes. Mrs. Ramsey?
How soon will they be there?
I can't do this.
If you think he's beyond help, you can leave the house if you want.
No, I'm staying here.
Do you think he's beyond help?
